value.0:
The pages of this book are fresh, despite having been read countless times.  In your eagerness to begin reading it you slightly rip one of the pages.  To your astonishment the rip heals itself before your very eyes.

"The Great Duir is the most sacred of trees held holy by all Druids.  It is rumored to be almost as old as the land itself, and Druids will defend this tree with their life.  It is the root of all existance to them.  Stories have been told of the Great Duir's long roots, digging deep into the ground and suckling life from The Mother directly.

It is rumoured that an ancient god, Taranis, would come down from the skies and mate with the Great Duir by striking it with lightning.  This is how he came to be known as the Thunder Lord.  Druids are known to carry pieces of lightning-blasted Duir as a symbol of protection, love, and mating.

As you stand under this enormous tree you feel a presence here - as if the tree itself were aware of you and watching over you.  As the wind blows through the leaves, a faint song can be heard that is relaxing and somewhat hypnotizing."
